sub_title: Sustainability Specialist | Marketing Professional | Social Enterprise Focus
summary:
I do purpose-driven work 🙂 Currently looking to assist impact driven organisation to scale up their business as a sustainability manager.

Over 10 years of experience as a development professional specializing in sustainability sector in Indonesia, Australia, Colombia, Nepal, Costa Rica with diverse types of clients (Government, NGOs, academic institutions, and start-up businesses). 

I am passionate about assisting businesses and organisations in bringing positive impact to the community through research, program design and implementation, partnership building, and exposure in public (marketing and PR).

I hold a double Master's Degree (Master of Environmental Management and Development and Master of Diplomacy) from The Australian National University and third Master Degree in Responsible Management & Sustainable Development from UN Mandated University for Peace, all under full scholarship.

I published 4 non-fiction books and one academic book with major publishers. In my spare time, I run a blog where I share my experience traveling to over 65 countries on 6 continents (www.travelingajadulu.com) and a podcast on sustainable business in Bali (www.livinginbalipodcast.com). Feel free to contact me for collaboration. 

Skills:

1. Project Management: 9+ years in designing, implementing and coordinating projects & programs.
2. Research & Writing: 5 book publications (3 co-authored), 2 accepted solo grant proposals each by USAID & AUSAID, and significant contributions for grant proposals and field/desktop research activities to diverse clients.
3. Event Organizing: 12+ years in organizing social & environmental impact projects.
4. Public Speaking: 10 + years in public speaking as a speaker, MC, and moderator. 

Specialities: development, sustainability, social impact.

•To share ideas and experiences on the implementation of low carbon economy by elaborating various technical/practical issues.
•To update the on-going initiatives and progresses on Asia’s mitigation actions to reduce GHG emission, particularly the most recent issues such as REDD+, MRV, climate financing and capacity building.
•To develop any potentials collaborative efforts among Asian countries in seeking a viable mechanisms in tackling climate change issues.

In 2012, AFCU was held from 15-17 February in Bandung.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Olivia Dianina', 'last_name': 'Purba', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Sustainability Specialist | Marketing Professional | Social Enterprise Focus'}]}, {'title': 'Indonesia Carbon Update', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'description': 'The Indonesia Carbon Update (ICU) 2011 is a continuation of previous meeting (ICU 2010) which aimed to share ideas, experiences and knowledge between the Government of Indonesia (GOI) and stake holders on mitigation issues, actions in Indonesia as well as stands on global negotiations.

Public Speaking: 10 + years in public speaking as a speaker, MC, and moderator.', 'title': 'Independent Consultant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 3797071, 'name': 'Plastic Bank', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQG4UFoVeEQ5aA/company-logo_400_400/0/1651176131874?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=N71mFpVX-kakKCLgMjEDovbuyUKhcxVH4DvBOIEJerE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/plasticbank/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bali, Indonesia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Plastic Bank', 'description': "Working with an impact tech startup focusing on global plastic recycling. I am in charge of developing community programs across Indonesia under close coordination with a global team in Canada, Brazil, Philipines & Egypt.

Design and implement community programs needed by over 12.000 plastic collectors in 12 provinces of Indonesia through gamification models (data-driven execution) to increase retention and gain new collectors. Result:

1. Rice Exchange program: 20 tons distributed
2. Insurance(BPJS Kes) :  > 1500 collectors  and their family covered
3. Social Welfare (BPJS Ket): > 1500 collectors covered
4. Mobile phone subsidy: > 500 new smartphones distributed 
5. Internet data programs >50k GB data distributed to junkyard owners
6. Bank account programs: >400 unbanked received their bank account
7. Water filters: 25 water filters distributed
8. Tablets for school children: 1850 tablets distributed
9. Scholarship to 25 students, 50 school kits and over 200 schoolbags

Acting Marketing Manager (June 2020- May 2021):
1. Design immediate strategy for marketing, including communication toolkits, branding toolkits, social media publications, video animations, video and photo story materials, printed materials (brochures/posters/flyers, stickers), and branding collateral (banner, T-shirts, tote bags, uniforms, etc)  
2. Create an inbound/outbound Customer Service experience through Whatsapp and SMS platforms, including SOP, FAQ, and schedule.
3. Revive social media of all channels, select & manage external social media agencies for content and posting and align with Plastic Bank Global Canada's vision on content.

'ForestAction Nepal', 'description': "During the semester break of my study at ANU, I conducted an internship for Forest Action Nepal (http://forestaction.org/), a Kathmandu-based think tank that focuses on research and policy dialogue for productive, equitable, and sustainable forest and natural resource management. As the work of this institution is closely related to my study at Crawford School of Public Policy ANU, I was able to compare my theoretical learning in the classroom with the real implementation on the ground. Moreover, during my time internship, I managed to conduct several field studies to observe the implementation of Community Based Forest Management in different districts in Nepal. 

I managed to present the findings from my field research in Nepal at ANU Student Research Conference 2015 held on 16 July 2015 and at the 15th Graduate Research Presentation at the University of Hawai'i in Manoa in February 2016.", 'title': 'Field Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 162587, 'name': 'The Australian National University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEZFo6J_z1gDA/company-logo_400_400/0/1611191891353?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=7F4-J85iYqNuycDK6W2EhXrG9yemBNGoSIgzZjMprLg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/australian-national-university/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Greater Jakarta Area, Indonesia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'The Australian National University', 'description': 'Under ANU-UGM Research Collaboration on Legislative Election, my work as a field researcher was as follow:

•	Conducting interviews to 30 legislative candidates and their successful team.
•	Conducting behavioral observations (candidate shadowing) to 5 legislative candidates and 5 members of the successful team, with a focus on the interaction of the candidate to their constituents and their campaign style.
•	Collecting data in form of daily report, interview summary, observations report, event report, and shadowing report.
•	Collecting documentation of audio / visual acquired during the research period.
•	Writing mid term reports and final reports based on the interviews and observations.

Within this project, I was able to co-write a book in Indonesian and English as follow:

•	Co-write Chapter 6 “Jakarta: Kesejahteraan Sosial dan Layanan untuk Konsistuen di Kota Metropolis” on a book “Politik Uang di Indonesia: Patronase dan Klientelisme pada Pemilu Legislatif 2014” published by PolGov UGM in January 2015
